meanings.definition: A crustacean with a broad carapace, stalked eyes, and five pairs of legs, the first pair of which are modified as pincers.
meanings.sent1: The crabs scuttled along the sandy beach.
meanings.sent2: I love watching crabs crawl on the rocks near the shore.
meanings.sent3: Why did the crab bring a shell to the party? Because it wanted to be the best-dressed crustacean!
meanings.sent4: Hermit crabs teach us that sometimes, home is wherever we carry it.
meanings.sent5: The crab's sideways walk is a unique and fascinating way of moving.

meanings.definition: A disease caused by parasitic lice infesting the pubic hair.
meanings.sent1: She felt embarrassed when she found out she had crabs.
meanings.sent2: Crabs are easily transmitted through close physical contact.
meanings.sent3: Why did the crab refuse to share its pubic hair? Because it was a very private crustacean!
meanings.sent4: The idea of having crabs can make anyone feel itchy all over.
meanings.sent5: Dealing with crabs requires prompt treatment and proper hygiene practices.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a crab and ruin the fun for everyone.
meanings.sent2: She woke up in a crabby mood and snapped at everyone she met.
meanings.sent3: Why did the crab refuse to share its toys? Because it was feeling a bit crabby!
meanings.sent4: His constant complaints made him the crab of the office.
meanings.sent5: Being around a crab can make even the sunniest day feel gloomy.
